definition: neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
to transmit/to lead/to guide/to conduct/to direct

sentences.english: The poor peasants, being the most revolutionary group, have gained the leadership of the peasant associations.
sentences.chinese: 貧農，因爲最革命，所以他們取得了農會的領導權。

sentences.english: The American way of management features are strong management leader-ship and unionism.
sentences.chinese: 美式管理的特色則爲強大的管理領導權及工會制度。

sentences.english: Answering that challenge depends in part on how one defines leadership.
sentences.chinese: 應對這個挑戰，一方面取決於如何定義領導權。

sentences.english: First, leadership must come from the top.
sentences.chinese: 首先，要有來自上層的領導權。

sentences.english: He argues that al-Qaeda's core leadership has been "neutralised operationally".
sentences.chinese: 他認爲本拉登的核心領導權已經“由中立者執行”。

sentences.english: They jockey for the leaderships of the party.
sentences.chinese: 他們不擇手段謀取黨的領導權。

sentences.english: The vice-president took over the leadership of the country.
sentences.chinese: 副總統接掌了國家領導權。

definition: United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
to charge and break through enemy lines
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
